file_content.text: You found what you wanted to know, now leave us in peace.
This bottle has your name on it, if you tell me where to find a certain pirate.
Genuine Somnaskol Red! Where'd you find that? That's the finest of the-- no.
You don't understand, Sith. If Andronikos Revel doesn't want to be found, nobody's going to find him. He'll kill me if I tell, or worse.
No Andronikos, no deal.
It depends.
Damn Sith. Twisting my arm. Baiting an honest Rodian.
How would you feel if I dropped this bottle?
I don't know.
No! Don't do that--! Do you know how rare this stuff is?
Lookit, give me the Red and I'll tell you what you want to know. Just don't tell Andronikos who told, okay? He'll kill me.
It's either that or this.
Make your choice. [Shock.]
Argh!
Blasted Sith. Fine. Give me the Red and don't ever do that to me again.
I told you, I don't know Andronikos.
I'm looking for a pirate named Andronikos Revel.
Look, even if I knew him, I wouldn't tell you where he is. Customers don't like bartenders who blab.
Not that I listen anyway.
Look, Sith, this is a peaceful establishment. We don't want any trouble. So buy a drink, enjoy yourself, but don't start nothing.
I won't start anything if you tell me what I want to know.
That's really up to you.
I'll have a drink, then.
Sure.
On the house, for our honored Sith guest. Next one'll cost you though.
I need to know where I can find Andronikos Revel.
Now for what I really want.
Who would pay for this stuff?
Not likely.
My brew ain't good enough for you? Then you're in the wrong place, Sith.
Sorry it ain't suited to your delicate tastes, but we serve mostly space trash and moisture farmers. And none of them is delicate.
I appreciate it.
Eh. I figure if you're drinking maybe you'll leave me alone.
Trouble follows me wherever I go.
Tough luck.
Then I suggest you get out before you drive away all my customers.
Bad enough most of them are rowdy, drunken space trash. Don't need a Sith stirring things up by poking his nose around.
Tell me where to find Andronikos Revel and I'll leave.
Let's make a deal.
You're not going to let this thing go are you?
For the last time, Sith, I don't know the fella. Never heard of him.
Now is there anything else I can do for ya, or can I get some peace?
Tell me where Andronikos Revel is!
Stop lying to me. [Shock him.]
Argh!
All right, all right! You want to know where Andronikos Revel is? I'll tell you. Just don't ever do that again.
It might get my intestines ripped out in the middle of the night, but I can't stand pain.
This Andronikos fellow is sounding better and better.
Wonderful.
I'll make sure Andronikos doesn't find out you told.
Don't worry.
Talk, dammit.
Andronikos keeps a room upstairs. He likes his privacy, and he pays me not to let on he's here.
'Course, it helps that the time he caught somebody telling on him to one of the Exchange gang, he blew both their brains out.
Bug him at your own risk. But if he's up in his room, it usually means he don't want to be bothered.
Do you know anyone who does know Andronikos?
I'm still pirate-less.
You'd better not be lying to me.
This is your last warning.
On my grandmother's grave, it's the truth. I don't know any Andronikos.
You won't insult me again.
Watch your mouth. [Shock.]
That's right, you don't.
Okay, okay, I get the picture. But I don't know where Andronikos Revel is.
Order a drink or leave me alone.
Your dancer says you know where to find Andronikos Revel.
Look look look, I don't know what that damn dancer told you, but I don't know Andronikos Revel. I only know of him.
She's the one who would know. Spends more time talking than dancing and spends most of it with the pirate.
What'll make this girl talk?
How do I get her to tell me?
She don't stop talking! But I don't know how to get her to say particular things.
I don't have patience for either of you right now.
Don't lie. [Shock him]
She lied to me!
The fool.
Trust me, you're not the only one she's crossed.
I just wish she'd spend less time yapping and more time doing her job.
But that girl'll do--or say--anything to keep from being fired, I mean, anything. So I can never bring myself to do it.
She'll say anything, huh.
Is that so?
You don't believe me? Why don't you try it for yourself?
I can't believe you.
I'd like to see you try it.
Take this letter so she knows you ain't bluffing her and see how she reacts.
That dancer's as good as dead.
Forget you.
Please, take it outside. I don't need any trouble!
Give that notice to that dancer, and she'll squawk all right.
You want to find him, try talking to that no-good worthless dancer. Spends more time flirting than dancing and more time yapping than either. I bet she's seen him.
